Definition.WordDefinition: Goodness in man is not a mere passive quality, but the deliberate preference of right to wrong, the firm and persistent resistance of all moral evil, and the choosing and following of all moral good.

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Goodness \Good"ness\, n. [AS. g[=o]dnes.] The quality of being good in any of its various senses; excellence; virtue; kindness; benevolence; as, the goodness of timber, of a soil, of food; goodness of character, of disposition, of conduct, etc. [1913 Webster]

goodness n 1: that which is good or valuable or useful; "weigh the good against the bad"; "among the highest goods of all are happiness and self-realization" [syn: {good}] [ant: {bad}, {bad}] 2: moral excellence or admirableness; "there is much good to be found in people" [syn: {good}] [ant: {evil}, {evil}]
